content: Against an 18% decline in industry unit shipments since 2019, our FX adjusted value-added sales has increased 8%, adjusted EBITDA margin has expanded by 280 basis points, and content per wheel has expanded 33%, collectively enabling us to reduce net debt by $120 million, and to refinance a significant portion of our capital structure. Adjusted EBITDA in the quarter increased to $58 million, a 26% margin, expressed as a percent of value-added sales compared to $37 million, a  (ph) margin in the prior-year period. Adjusted EBITDA increased to $194 million, a 25% margin expressed as a percent of value-added sales compared to $167 million or 22% margin in the prior-year period.
